column1: Malvegil was the son of [[Celebrindor]], and gained the kingship of [[Arthedain]] upon his father's death in {{TA

column3: n}}) that the [[Witch-king]] saw an opportunity in the disunion of the [[Arnorians]] and he went to the North and founded [[Angmar]].  To this realm were drawn evil men, [[Orcs]] (who begin attacking the [[Dwarves]]), and other fell creatures. column1: Malvegil ruled Arthedain for seventy-seven years, and was succeeded by his son [[Argeleb I]] in {{TA

Malvegil's name probably means "Sword of Gold" or "Golden Sword", being a combination of the [[Sindarin]] words ''mall-'' meaning "gold", and ''megil'' (becoming lenited to ''vegil'') meaning "sword".<ref>{{LR
